headline: Solventum Stock Jumps After $4.1B Deal With Thermo Fisher
summary: Shares of Solventum jumped Tuesday and led S&P 500 gainers intraday after medical device maker Thermo Fisher Scientific said it would acquire the company’s purification and filtration business for $4.1 billion.

headline: Thermo Fisher Strikes Deal for Solventum’s Filtration Unit
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific  said Tuesday it is buying  Solventum’s  purification and filtration business, confirming an earlier report by The Wall Street Journal.  Thermo Fisher said it is paying about $4.1 billion in cash for the business.  The Journal reported in October that Solventum, the healthcare company spun off from  3M  last year, had retained bankers to explore a sale of its purification and filtration unit.

raw.headline: Thermo Fisher Strikes Deal for Solventum’s Filtration Unit
raw.summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific  said Tuesday it is buying  Solventum’s  purification and filtration business, confirming an earlier report by The Wall Street Journal.  Thermo Fisher said it is paying about $4.1 billion in cash for the business.  The Journal reported in October that Solventum, the healthcare company spun off from  3M  last year, had retained bankers to explore a sale of its purification and filtration unit.

headline: Thermo Fisher buys Solventum's purification and filtration business for $4.1 billion
summary: The deal should allow Thermo to enter the filtration category in bioprocessing, where peers Danaher and Repligen are more strongly positioned, said Leerink Partners analyst Puneet Souda.  The business, which provides filters for the purification of food or beverages and drugs during development, brought in about $1 billion in revenue in 2024, Thermo said.  Evercore analyst Vijay Kumar said the deal is expected to complement Thermo's bioprocessing business, which provides tools and services to accelerate the drug development process for biopharma companies.

Evercore analyst Vijay Kumar said the deal is expected to complement Thermo's bioprocessing business, which provides tools and services to accelerate the drug development process for biopharma companies.

headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific to Acquire Solventum’s Purification and Filtration Business
summary: WALTHAM, Mass., February 25, 2025--Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) ("Thermo Fisher"), the world leader in serving science, today announced that the company has entered into a definitive agreement with Solventum (NYSE: SOLV) to acquire Solventum’s Purification & Filtration business for approximately $4.1 billion in cash.

raw.headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific to Acquire Solventum’s Purification and Filtration Business
